title: Understanding Procedures
text: A procedure is a set of instructions that a program follows to perform a specific task. It is often triggered by an event, such as a button click.

title: Event-Driven Programming
text: In event-driven programming, code is executed in response to events like user actions (e.g., clicking a button).

hintAnswer: the code executed in response to an event
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes a procedure in programming?
choices: the code executed in response to an event
